snippet: Giving healthy men P.S.A. blood tests for prostate cancer does not save lives and often leads to treatment that can cause needless pain and side effects, a government panel said.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: United States Preventive Services Task Force

lead_paragraph: Giving healthy men P.S.A. blood tests for prostate cancer does not save lives and often leads to treatment that can cause needless pain and side effects, a government panel said.

headline.main: U.S. Panel Says No to Prostate Screening for Healthy Men
headline.print_headline: U.S. Panel Says No To Prostate Test For Healthy Men
headline.seo: U.S. Panel Advises Against Routine Prostate Test
